intro: Eucalyptus calycogona, commonly known as the narrow-leaf stringy gum, is a species of eucalyptus native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, often twisted trunk and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically grey-green in color. The flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and they bloom during the spring and summer seasons. This plant is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in woodland and heathland environments. It plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
